Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Compiler crashes when building an Android Project (OSX)" (#1674) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

Either compile the project using Visual Studio for Mac, or `msbuild` on Terminal. 

Android build tools tried: `27.0.3` and `26.0.3`.
Mono Frameworks tried: `4.8.0` and `4.8.1`. (Mono 4 is required to run legacy libraries).

### Expected Behavior

Compile and generate `.apk` file.

### Actual Behavior

On Visual Studio for Mac, an alert with "Fatal error" message appears, then it closes automatically (without clicking on OK button of the alert window).

On Terminal the following message appears (full output attached):

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tests] Fix BuildHelper Root" (#2242) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Some of the tests in monodroid are failing because
it was assumed that the test `Root` folder would be
in the project output directory.

However with the new `XAConfig` file changes in XA that
is no longer the case. As a result some of the unit tests
fail because it is looking for files in the wrong place.

This commit changes the `Root` property of the `ProjectBuilder`
to use the one from `XAConfig`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "the "linkassemblies" task failed for Android Xamarin Forms" (#1521) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @ExzaSolutions on December 27, 2017 8:25_

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description

When the Xamarin Forms Project builds the Android build fails.
The android is set to build to Release,and the linking is set to Sdk Assemblies only.
When it is set to None it builds successfully,but the apk is far too big then.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Nuget Packages to Xamarin Forms Solution
2. Set Android Project To Release and linking to Sdk Assemblies only.
3. Build Solution

### Expected Behavior
Should build successfully

### Actual Behavior
Fails with "LinkAssemblies" task failed unexpectedly. System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "No resource found that matches given name" (#1730) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download braintree dropin .aar file from https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.braintreepayments.api/drop-in/3.3.0 
2. Now create a Xamarin android Class Library project and add .aar file into Jar folder and set build action as LibraryProjectZip

Error: No resource found that matches the given name: attr 'textColorError'.

If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->

### Expected Behavior
It needs to compile .aar or .jar file successfully.
### Actual Behavior
Getting above error.
### Version Information
Download braintree dropin .aar file from https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/com.braintreepayments.api/drop-in/3.3.0

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WCF service integration does not work with Visual Studio 2017 15.5.4" (#1209) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

When you create a new Xamarin Project in Visual Studio 2017 using .Net Standard libraries, the access to a WCF web service does no longer work. Even the example project by Xamarin does produce the same issue.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download the Xamarin example: https://developer.xamarin.com/guides/xamarin-forms/cloud-services/consuming/wcf/
2. Build with Visual Studio 2017 15.5.4
3. Run Android App on a real device

### Expected Behavior
Method call to web service works (method: SoapService.RefreshDataAsync)

### Actual Behavior
Exception: The message with Action '' cannot be processed at the receiver, due to a ContractFilter mismatch at the EndpointDispatcher. This may be because of either a contract mismatch (mismatched Actions between sender and receiver) or a binding/security mismatch between the sender and the receiver.  Check that sender and receiver have the same contract and the same binding (including security requirements, e.g. Message, Transport, None).

### Basic Information

- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 15.5.4
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  Not tested
  - Android: Android SDK 7.1
  - UWP:  Not tested
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Tab A (2016)

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] CopyResource should fail with an error code" (#2237) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/pull/609

In a recent change, we removed `StubApplication.java`, but downstream
in `monodroid` we had MSBuild tasks that still expected the file to
exist.

We got an error such as:

    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: The "CopyResource" task failed unexpectedly.
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.CopyResource.Run (System.Reflection.Assembly assm, System.String ResourceName, System.String OutputPath, Microsoft.Build.Utilities.TaskLoggingHelper Log) [0x00058] in <5782345e71104ee895a29d54bde93c43>:0
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Xamarin.Android.Tasks.CopyResource.Execute () [0x00018] in <5782345e71104ee895a29d54bde93c43>:0
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute () [0x00023] in <528faf194f4946628868b84241d6ad15>:0
    Xamarin.Android.Common.Debugging.targets(319,2): error MSB4018: at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder+<ExecuteInstantiatedTask>d__26.MoveNext () [0x001f6] in <528faf194f4946628868b84241d6ad15>:0

The `CopyResource` MSBuild task should fail more gracefully: log a
coded error, and mention the file name that was missing.

In addition to this change:
- Added `CopyResourceTests` to verify resources that should be
  working, and the error code if it fails. We should add to the list
  if there are other files we want to verify are working. This test is
  very fast (<1s for entire class), because it doesn't need to build
  an entire project.
- Documented the `XA0116` error code.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Trying to deploy a andriod app to the simualtor fails. With a standard libary with entity framework core." (#1801) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @davidbuckleyni on June 2, 2018 12:0_

<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
I have been trying to use xamrain with a simple model for years now and every other release it seems to get worse than better, Please guys make this my goto development tools for andriod and ios please.
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamrian Forms app add an existing .net standard core libary with ef core 2.02 to the app.
 
### Expected Behavior
App to launch and show data from dl core libary
### Actual Behavior

Project will not even build with this version and deploy to the simliautor.

### Basic Information

Android application is debugging.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[libzip] Remove building of i386 on MacOS." (#2221) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Xcode 10.0 deprecates compiling of 32bit applications.

	The macOS 10.14 SDK no longer contains support for compiling
	32-bit applications. If developers need to compile for i386, Xcode
	9.4 or earlier is required. (39858111)

So just build 64bit everywhere.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ArgumentOutOfRangeException is thrown when removing data from a list view on iOS" (#3938) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

Occasionally, when removing items from a list view, I encounter an ArgumentOutOfRangeException. This causes the app to crash.

```

  at (wrapper managed-to-native) ObjCRuntime.Messaging.void_objc_msgSend(intptr,intptr)
  at UIKit.UITableView.EndUpdates () [0x00008] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/12.0.0.15/src/Xamarin.iOS/UIKit/UITableView.g.cs:294 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS.ListViewRenderer.UpdateItems (System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs e, System.Int32 section, System.Boolean resetWhenGrouped) [0x00180] in <66855f87e3b64ff38a3e1034f86d8129>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS.ListViewRenderer.OnCollectionChanged (System.Object sender, System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs e) [0x00000] in <66855f87e3b64ff38a3e1034f86d8129>:0 
  at Xamarin.Forms.Internals.TemplatedItemsList`2[TView,TItem].OnCollectionChanged (System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs e) [0x0000a] in <3a9c335d80a748a29a8f8588acbed83f>:0

  at Xamarin.Forms.ListProxy+<>c__DisplayClass33_0.<OnCollectionChanged>b__0 () [0x00018] in D:\a\1\s\Xamarin.Forms.Core\ListProxy.cs:206 
  at Foundation.NSAsyncActionDispatcher.Apply () [0x00000] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/12.0.0.15/src/Xamarin.iOS/Foundation/NSAction.cs:152 
  at (wrapper managed-to-native) UIKit.UIApplication.UIApplicationMain(int,string[],intptr,intptr)
  at UIKit.UIApplication.Main (System.String[] args, System.IntPtr principal, System.IntPtr delegate) [0x00005] in /Library/Frameworks/Xamarin.iOS.framework/Versions/12.0.0.15/src/Xamarin.iOS/UIKit/UIApplication.cs:79

  at MyApp.iOS.Application.Main (System.String[] args) [0x00001] in /Users/sykorkx/Workspace/MyApp_XamarinMobile/src/MyApp.iOS/Main.cs:17 
```

### Steps to Reproduce

Honestly I'm not sure quite yet what triggers this behavior, but since it's not hitting my app code at all, I have to assume there is some consistency behavior with model binding in the list view cells going on which is causing this to occur.

Possibly adding / removing / clearing rows from the list view will cause this to happen (I think when I was testing, I was removing items from a list view, but it doesn't always occur.)

If I can isolate it to a specific scenario, I'll update the issue.

### Expected Behavior

Exception is caught and handled by Xamarin, or calling code's behavior is throw an exception to handle due to whatever condition initially caused the issue.

### Actual Behavior

Exception is thrown from outside user application code and app crashes

### Basic Information

  - UWP:  n/a

- Nuget Packages: 
- Affected Devices: Behavior occurred on iPhone 7 running iOS 11.4.1 (Note the app was built against iOS 12.0)

If I can isolate the issue I will create a production.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Use UIPopoverPresentationController for Pickers on large(r) screen devices" (#3937) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
At present, using a Picker on iPad results in a giant widget appearing at the bottom of the screen. I've been looking, and haven't been able to find any examples of this style of picker being used on modern apps on iPad. With the larger screen real estate on the iPad (and on most phones nowadays), I think using a popover to display lists of options is probably more appropriate. Aside from anything else, it will provide a visual cue to the user as to what it is that they're selecting.

There are some separate tickets open about making popover views available in general so that we can fill them with whatever content we want. However the case I'm making here is that it makes sense for the default rendering of Pickers on iPad (at least) be updated. This way Pickers on Mac and Pickers on iPad will work roughly the same.
